alert.note: Alert for Russell (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 23 at 4:51PM CDT until June 23 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Central Kansas, including the following county, Russell. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone areas is likely, as well as some street flooding in and around towns. Low-water crossings may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 451 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low- lying and flood-prone areas is likely, as well as some street flooding in and around towns. Low-water crossings may not be passable. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area through the evening. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Russell, Lucas, Gorham, Luray, Dorrance, Bunker Hill, Paradise, Waldo, Russell Airport, Wilson Lake and Wilson State Park.
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown.
